bibl.title: Letter from Harvey E. Jordan to Philip Showalter Hench, October 24, 1940

div1.p: Jordan writes about the Moran dinner, held the night before, and reports that Moran spoke very well.

div1.head: Letter from Harvey E. Jordan to Philip Showalter Hench, October 24, 1940
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
DEPARTMENT OF MEDICINE
CHARLOTTESVILLE
October 24, 1940
OFFICE OF THE DEAN
Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I wish to acknowledge receipt of
your letter of October 21st. Unfortunately
it came to my office only on the morning of
October 23rd. As you know, the Medical Faculty
dinner in honor of Mr. Moran was given on the
night of October 22nd. I feel that the dinner
was a pleasant and successful affair and that
Mr. Moran and General Kean were greatly pleased.
Approximately thirty-five members of the
Faculty attended the dinner. By some clever
maneuvering on the part especially of General
Kean, Mr. Moran was led to answer questions
from the Faculty and I should say he spoke for
approximately three-quarters of an hour, and I
want to add that he spoke very well and gave us
some interesting information. I also regret
that a stenographer was not present to take down
the remarks. However, your brother was at the
dinner and he told me before he left that he
would return home immediately and write out a
full account of the dinner and the speeches to
transmit to you.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, H. E. Jordan, Dean. HEJ/MHL
